review: ok there are a couple of things  that a 'non-computer»  person should probably know,  one-  if you have an android device such as mine's a kindle fire'  chromecast will no be supported on this device.  two-  it will tie up any device that supports chromecast, the mirroring aspect of it.  which means that you can't use your tv controls but the mirrored device, ie phone, computer or kindle. three-there are limited apps that support the chromecast amazon prime streaming is not one of them.  it was not what i expected which was to be able to use my tv controls and the select apps available could not be used without tying my phone which because I have an older computer and kindle fire, was the only device I would be able to use with chromecast.  this was my experience and am sending it back and don't forget there will be a $5.00 restocking fee.

I decided Windows 8 pretty much stinks a long time ago and it doesn't surprise me that it makes this thing not work well either.  With the tablet, it's sweet.

review: I owned a Roku3 before I purchased this for a secondary television. It took me several tries to get it working correctly. I have a router extender, and it doesn't work well with one. I finally got it to work with my original router, but I think there will be delays in the projection because of the distance to my router. Anyway, the app works well. I am not sure if the Chromcast has as much content available. I haven't used it a lot, so I can't say for sure. I bought it because I am about to ditch cable and wanted another option for my televisions.
